abstract_ssm: The collection comprises eleven leatherbound diaries kept by Frederick Paddock Fowler, a native of Brooklyn, during the years 1885-1895.  Spanning his late adolescence and early adulthood, the diaries include brief, handwritten entries made daily that record his day-to-day life in the Fort Greene neighborhood of Brooklyn during this period.
geogname_ssm: Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.) -- Social life and customs -- 19th century
